body.name: Best Friends: An absolutely gripping psychological thriller with a heart-stopping twist
body.description: She knows everything about you… and she’s about to share your deepest, darkest secret.Alice has everything, I mean everything. A stunning suburban house, Instagram-perfect in its soft grey walls and textured neutrals. And then there's her handsome husband, with his flat stomach and that sexy sleeve of tattoos he keeps hidden for his well-paid job in the city. The PTA mamas can't stop staring at him, and who can blame them? And let's not forget her three adorable, well-behaved children.Meanwhile, here in Boston, I'm struggling to start a family with my husband Ollie. Our marriage is suffering, and I feel so isolated all the time. It's hard not to compare myself to Alice, especially when we unexpectedly reconnect after two decades of silence. I can't help feeling I've been dealt the inferior hand in life.The worst thing is, I know Alice doesn't deserve any of it. I was once her very best friend in the world, and I know the real Alice better than anyone else.And here’s me thinking… I know where the bodies are buried, literally. Maybe it’s time to make her pay?This gripping tale of friendship, love, betrayal, and revenge is full of twist after brilliant twist. It will keep you reading late into the night, perfect for fans of Gone Girl, My Lovely Wife, and The Girl Before.What readers are saying about Best Friends:“Oh WOW! I totally loved this book! I read in in just one day. Captivating from the very beginning and the twists and turns did not let up until the final page. Fantastic characters! This story was the perfect blend of tension, surprises and fabulous reveals.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“I requested this on the recommendation of a friend… THIS book does NOT disappoint. I literally messaged my friend and said WTAF did I just read?! You will not want to miss this twisted story of friendship and betrayal.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“I loved this book! I was gripped from the start and raced through it. The ending was outstanding… the perfect psychological thriller.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“An emotional rollercoaster… As the reader is pulled into Alice and Evie’s friendship, the tension ratchets and twists come thick and fast.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“This book was a gripping, fantastic read… It had me on the edge of my seat… I honestly can’t wait for the author’s next book!” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“Heart-pounding thriller that left me on the edge of my seat… Definitely one of the best books this year.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Read more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: What readers are saying about Best Friends
Psychological thriller for fans of Gone Girl, The Girl Before and My Lovely Wife

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was.a super good read. A little different then your typical psychological thriller. Characters well developed and well written. Don't get me wrong, there was quite a twist in the end that I didn't even suspect. I'm super picky about giving out stars. Well deserved 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It has everything
reviews.reviewText: This book has it all , it sucks you right in ,not wanting to put it downHas all the twists and unexpected mind blowers. Loved it - all

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Friends ebook novel
reviews.reviewText: This novel was one I could not put down. It wash addictive to the very last paragraph. The plot and subplots were always evolving. Even the ending makes the reader wonder what might happen next. The protagonist starts off as a good girl with a lot of odds against her. She does not play the victim easily, yet life seems to double-cross her so many times that her personality develops into that of a sociopath. Her worst enemy is a psychopath, so she has to fight fire with fire. It takes one, to know one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good debut novel
reviews.reviewText: This was a good debut novel. I think I expected more due to the author’s pen name! Ha ha.The novel is told solely from one POV which I think was a mistake as I believe a third person account of the side characters could have added more dimension. Even though I know the purpose of only giving us Evie’s point of view is deliberate in order for twists to occur, the twists were really flat.All in all I would read this author again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading this. The story was good & the pages flew by.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book will really hold your attention!
reviews.reviewText: I like the way the author developed each character, and the story was well-paced. Most of us knew at least one "Alice" in high school. Unfortunately, I knew several so there were times when this story was painful. However, I still enjoyed it and would like to read my books by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Intriguing psychological thriller
reviews.reviewText: Intriguing psychological thriller about two high school best friends, reunited after many years. The story takes many unexpected twists and turns, leading to a somewhat shocking and surprising ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars couldn’t put it down
reviews.reviewText: Couldn’t put it down. Great twist and fun to read. Hooked quickly. Story was a psychological thriller and unexpected ending!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book had me gripped from the beginning to end. I took it on holiday. Reading it in bed was not a good idea as I couldn’t put it down. It was an exciting read.I like the short chapters and the testing between the women. I didn’t have a clue how it would end and I wasn’t disappointed. Needless to say Alice and Evie are most definitely not friends.I would absolutely read another book by Rebecca De Winter.Good first book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: A dark and twisty revenge thriller
reviews.reviewText: Evie and Alice were childhood neighbours and best friends but it’s been 20 years since Evie suddenly left their school and the last time they spoke. Now, Evie is moving back to the UK and despite their previously toxic relationship she just can’t stop herself from contacting Alice, who seems to have everything Evie covets.I found the first half of the book quite emotional as Evie deals with her fertility issues and a failing marriage, but once she reunites with Alice the story really ramps up into a dark and twisty thriller. Told entirely from Evie’s point of view we only have her word to rely on but it’s clear both women have a past they’d rather keep hidden and will stop at nothing to keep it that way.The plot is fast-paced, extremely readable and full of surprises. It’s a tale of love, friendship, and revenge served ice cold! There’s some difficult themes in the story but De Winter has managed to pull it off in style, I’m looking forward to seeing what she writes next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Rebecca De Winter has delivered a turbulent, twisting tale for her debut novel. The book is written at a steady pace and the reader is quickly drawn into Evie’s world and her mixed feelings about childhood best friend, Alice.After decades of no contact, Evie and Alice reconnect, but everything isn’t as rosey as is should be…The story gripped me instantly and Evie was easy to connect with. De Winter’s writing has feminist touches woven into it and is narrated from Evie’s point of view.I read this in two sittings and found it hard to put down. I didn’t see the twist coming (and it’s a good one!) .I can’t wait to see what other stories this writer delivers. I really enjoyed Best Friends and highly recommend it to people who like fast-moving thrillers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Gripping book full of interesting twists and turns!!!
reviews.reviewText: I loved reading this book from start to finish and I am gutted that there are no more pages left!!!Just when you think that you know what is going on, here comes another great twist.It's great read, gripping from start to finish.Definitely recommend it 👌🏼

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Creepy like Gone Girl, lots of twists
reviews.reviewText: Fab story that was hard to put down. Reminded me of ‘Gone Girl’ in places with the suspense and wonderfully crafted characters. Definitely recommend.
